description: The Banco de Alimentos in Paraguay, established in the 1990s and formalized in 2004, aims to combat food waste and hunger. With a dedicated team of six, they collect and distribute food surpluses to over 100 organizations, primarily serving vulnerable communities. Their operations rely on donations, partnerships, and international cooperation, focusing on logistics and advocacy to enhance their impact. Future plans include expanding collection centers and improving food processing capabilities.
name: Banco de Alimentos
